text: Cool environment. Older music and music videos were playing in the background. Bar tender was a bit of a d*^k and very short with our group.

My friend and I were denied entry to this place last night because the bouncer didn't want anymore people in. He wanted to close early. I tried telling him we were industry people and still he didn't care and was extremely rude. I'll never go back. Which is sad because I live in the neighborhood.

This place was awesome. The music was great rock and roll they played classic rock, Michael Jackson, the Beatles... Just really good music. And the crowd was diverse and everyone one was so friendly and talkative. I loved the bar tender! She was so kind and funny! Plus it's open late.

late night bar in wrigleyville, that plays rock music! Sick of the same awful music at the bars, come to trace. Prices are typical, staff is super friendly and chill. Late night bar, don't think they serve food. They play rock music and have the videos on the t.v.s Cool place that gets crowded. Been here twice, would stop by again. Not very often I am up to staying out for a 5 am place but this is one of the places I would go.

3 stars for being open late!! the bartender was great and had just seen us at taco bell like 10 mins earlier, which makes us kindred spirits. I don't know if this is a standout bar as I was here on a Monday...well, technically, tuesday morning, but it was clean and had decent beer on tap so a girl can't complain.

Great service but holy crap snooze fest. The bartenders aren't in control of the music and it's on a whatever playlist which is the kind of playlist to make me sleepy. I wish the bartenders could have more control of the music because it might as well be classical to put me to sleep on the rail.

Service was quick but bartender was rude. Place was packed and the people were friendly. The creepy guys took no for an answer. There is no tab minimum so you could stop in for one or two drinks after a game.  Pleasant experience!
awesome music. solid as fuck. like iron. but with less metal and more hair.

By default I dislike 4am bars.  From the outset, they have a large burden to overcome because I'll spend my money there.  Trace starts off with two strikes for being in Wrigleyville and for having an Ed Hardy-esque logo.  But Trace is a 4am bar I might just have a soft spot for.  Even after 2am, it's lively without being overbearing.  If you're in Lakeview and the bartender has just called last-call, head up to Trace.

Trace is my favorite late bar in the city. It is a two floor sports bar with several TVs and reasonably priced drinks. There is always a variety of popular music playing throughout the night, accompanied by music videos displayed on all of the TVs. It starts to get really crowded at 2 AM, when most other bars close, so I suggest getting there a bit earlier to avoid the line. The crowd is very diverse, so you can meet anyone and everyone here. I love it. It's always a good time!

Trace is one of those places you can go to meet a variety of different people, some of which that just wanna to get to know you and some of which that just wanna "get to know you", hey it's a late night bar in Wriggly, what'd you expect? Seriously though, it's just a great time and a place where if you take a chance and get out there you end up having some great conversations and a good time dancing off all those tequila shots you had earlier. It's a place that stays open late and keeps the music going. It's a little compact on the first floor, but near the back by the bar it gets a bit more roomy.  The upstairs is usually open but doesn't get very full, even on Saturdays. Overall it's a fun spot with just the right amount of chill to end your late night/early morning.

This place looks kinda sketchy but it was a blasts. but it was just a good time with good music the men in there were kinda creepy and the line was insanely long and unbearable! They seriously let people in one at a time. The drinks were strong and the staff was friendly bartenders were quick and efficient. It's a good after hours spot people do get weird here so brace yourself!

Came here for a beer before the Bad Religion show at the Metro. Wasn't too crowded, but it was pretty early. Got a seat at the bar and enjoyed a nice cold beer in peace. Had a banana bread beer on tap that was really good. Plenty of room to sit at the bar or to grab a table. Bathrooms were very clean. I'd stop in again for a drink or two.

We visited some friends who live in the area and they brought us to this bar for late night.  Very few things on draft with a full bar that they don't seem to plan on using.  I asked what they had (as I don't understand the late night bar thing coming from NYC where things just fully stay open through the night) and the bartender just gave a sarcastic face and didn't answer so- I ordered a margarita and she gave me another snide look so my friend from town ordered me a beer.  Apparently they didn't serve anything fancy like a margarita at late night which is fine but exactly the reason I asked.  I don't think she was trying to come off rude and I'm sure she deals with a whole bunch of drunk characters (given the shift) but we happened to come in sober.  The other bartender who settled our check was way more friendly.    The place gets very crowded and accumulated a long line once the other bars closed.  Their upstairs is frat house humid and hot.  It'd be fine to come here if you just want to party and are already intoxicated from the previous stop.  Good scene to keep the party going.

Worst experience at a bar I've ever had.  We came here to have a couple drinks and they had recently painted the entire upstairs.  The fumes were unbearable so we opened a window to try to relieve the smell.  A bouncer approached us, flashed a flashlight to his other partner, and slammed the window shut.  I told him "we opened the window because the paint smell was so strong," and his response was "don't touch the window bro".  I have bartended for over ten years and never experienced such poor customer service.  I will never return, and I hope if you read this review you won't either.

Place everyone comes after all the 2 am bars are closed. The only place in wrigley that stays open until 5am. It's not a club kinda place just a sit down with friends and have a beer. This place is very cramped on the weekends. Overall a decent time!

There are few times within my memory where I have gotten worse service and worse product. Luckily this was one of those times! Not only was I shorted $5 on ordering 2 $6 beers, one of which was extremely cloudy and not normal. I had to ask the bar-back who luckily knew the bartender's name ...Jeanette. So I asked what kind of 3 Sheeps Draft it was on currently and she said it was some malty something. Also, upon returning my change in which she naturally miscalculated $5 shorting me, ahe insisted that I would be held accountable if her drawer was off. She proceeded to give me a taste in a pint glass with no description whatsoever. Anyway, I was wise enough to decline the taster and ordered a Revolution Anti-Hero as a substitute in which I knew the style, color and flavor profile. The beer I received was extremely cloudy and not normal, along with a snooty attitude from the bartender for not liking the taster she gave me without description. Needless to say, I will never recommend this venue to anyone I care about.

Trace never fails to be a destination for an interesting night. They play some pretty good music, lots of good alternative. The bar tenders are pretty efficient. Met a piss drunk Zach Galifinakis lookalike there. The bouncers tend to have a good sense for any creeps and know when to intervene. Overall, enjoyable bar, especially for a 4am.

VISA CARD INFO STOLEN. This place is the epitome of awful. I walked into this bar (during my birthday) and the bartender was extremely rude. Seemed to only focus on her group of friends at the end of bar. My roommate and I sat at the bar and ordered a beer. He quickly left because he didn't like the vibe. I too left shortly after finishing my beer. The next morning, I look at my charges and was charged $200 at this place (all fraud) from this bar. Looks like the bartender gave her friends free drinks off my tab. I feel used. Please don't step foot in Trace.

First time there couldn't of been better! I had one of the best times in a long time there this past Friday night. Music was great to dance/ sing along to, drinks nicely priced, woman's bathroom was CLEAN even at 3am which was such a happy surprise and rarity to find!

This place has a large crowd, decent beer list, and even an upstairs so there is plenty of room.  It is a pretty typical 4AM bar that gets flooded when all of the other bars close.  The bar tending is so so.  It is hard to tell when it is pretty busy, so when mistakes were made, I tried to give the benefit of the doubt.  The biggest complaint is that the bouncers were very rude and unreasonably pushy!  I understand that as a bouncer, you're dealing with extremely drunk people all the time and probably get jaded from that kind of job.  But seriously, you don't have to be an asshole to every person that walks in.  And when people are leaving, you don't have to help them by grabbing them by the neck and tossing them out. Trying to finish my beer by the door before leaving, I was "escorted" out briskly.  Once outside, I also saw them being dicks to other people, as they were flipping them off for whatever reason.  I mean, really??    I feel like this review will probably fall on deaf ears (or blind eyes?), but I just don't want to go to a place where I have to put up with people who have personal issues they need to take out on others.  Thought we'd give this 4AM bar a try, but not gonna go back.  Tai's til 4 it is.

I went here last night (7/4/13) for the second time. I went at 2 am and stayed till 4 as it's an afterbar.  Pros: * It gets packed with drunk people so your bound to end your night with some laughs or interesting events to say the least haha.  * Fun dive bar Cons: * The female bartender with crazy hair (looks like a black hair piece/wig with a white bow type thing in the back) is AWFUL!  3 prominent things happened last night that make me say this. 1. We ordered car bombs and vegas bombs and she used a very short plastic glass and put the bomb part in a small shot glass... Usually with vegas bombs, you can just add the red bull right in... It didn't fit in the cup and overflowed.  2. She spilled my friends glass that was half way full with a vodka cran and just said "sorry".. didn't even replace it!. 3. The bus boy took my gin and tonic that was more than halfway full as well as my friends beer (I have NO CLUE why as it obviously wasn't empty). I told her about it and she replied with "the bus boy took that, not me"... OKAY, well you're still an employee here so do something about it! That's NO excuse...  4. My friend ordered a miller light and paid for it, she put it in front of the wrong person so my friend never knew... he said "can I have the miller light I ordered", she said "4.25, and popped one open. He mentioned that he already paid for it, and she said, oh well I put it over there (wrong person).. She made him pay for another one anyway.. (shouldn't be charging people for your mistakes). Anyway, I will come here again because this is a fun after hours bar, but if I have that bartender again, I won't leaving her any tips.. She was just AWFUL.

As a former General Manager of a bar and over 20 years of experience in the hospitality industry the owner of the bar is the main thing that ruined my experience. Here's the plus side of the place. 1. Very good to selection of beer for a late night place. 2. Good room to move throughout the spot. Bad: The owner. Stay out of your own bar.

I went to Trace last night. One of the bartenders (a short, stocky blonde woman) ripped me off. I gave her money for a drink and she didn't give me my change back. When I asked her about it, she became extremely confrontational and said, "We can go check the security cameras if you want." I decided it wasn't worth my time to go into some back room and review security camera footage at 2 AM in order to recover $3. It IS worth my time though to write this review and share my experience. I've lived in Chicago all my life, and I honestly have never encountered such terrible customer service. If you're looking for a 4 AM bar, go to Social 25 on Hubbard St. It's a big meat market, but at least the bartenders there won't rip you off.

No, no and no!! This is definitely one of those late night bars filled with horny creeps. This is one of the worst bars in Wrigley. By the time you roll around to this bar, all of the good people in Wrigley have already found someone to go home.Trace is where the leftovers hang out. If you don't want to go home after the bars close, go to Taco Bell instead.

Staff here is great. Steps away from wrigley. Awesome music everything from 90s alternative to big sean. Ordered a bloody mary once on a really slow night cuz I was curious on what it tastes like and it surprisingly was amazing.

This bar is great for late night drinks and I've always loved the bartenders here but the bartender that I've had to serve me the last couple of times have been been unfathomably rude. I'm not only a patron but a regular and friends with other bar owners in this area... I've worked in restaurant business and couldn't  imagine treating loyal customers with the amount of disrespect that this particular woman has treated me with in your bar.  This bartender is not only bad for business but gives your bar a negative name.  She treats customers as if it is their privilege and not hers and she deserves a major reality check. Perhaps more people would be inclined to hang out here if they felt sincerely welcome and not judged./ bad for business and I hate to post such a negative review but I feel forced to and hope the owners of Trace will reconsider current decisions of employment. Unless you want a complete male population in your bar, I would suggest this blonde, stocky bar tender, who is there almost every night to be seriously talked to.

Been there a handful of times and it's generally been OK. Service is extremely slow and the bar tenders just assume you're wasted and don't give you the time of day, which is par for the course considering it's a 4am bar. If I'm at Trace it usually means I've made a bad decision somewhere along in the night, most likely the 10 mins leading up to getting there. It's nice to have a 4am bar around the corner though.
Great service, especially if you're a regular.  Open till 4am. Decent flat HD TVs.
Don't come here on a ticket. They won't let you in

Went here after a crazy night in Wrigleyville.  My friends and I were at a bar down the street (forgot the name) and it was lamer than lame.  We asked the bouncer there where the closest bar was that was open late.  He told us to head to Trace which was right down the street.  We had a BLAST.  The bartenders were fun, quick, and friendly.  I met a lot of fun, new people and the environment was just awesome.  During last call, some of the bouncers got a little feisty but overall, it was a great experience.  We will definitely be coming back soon!

I came here with some rather drunk people after celebrating a 21st birthday at Sluggers. It's a 4 am bar, but don't let that fool you into thinking that this place is dirty or a dive. It's not the best place to hang out but when your friends are going full steam ahead, Trace won't let you down. I don't believe I even had a drink here, I was on full out damage control with my friends. The doormen were the best I've seen in Wrigley. They were nice but firm and gave the gross sleazy guys something to be afraid of. It was packed and the bar area is a bit narrow so be prepared to wait 2 or 3 deep for a drink. It was also a bit hot, I know I was sweating and I wasn't drinking or dancing. The music is good despite the fact that they don't have live music or a DJ. It's not the best bar in the area but it'll do when I just don't want to go home.

Actual text from my phone: Friend "Just got off work. Where are you guys?" Me "Trace Trace in your face. Get your ass here now.com" So, as we all know, 4am bars may not be the best decision you can make all night. But, if you are going here, at least you are making a better decision then going to Tai's til 4 or Big Shitty. This place is actually clean, including the bathrooms. And they play great music. There is no jukebox or dj, just someone's really good collection of rock music. The doormen are great. If some skeezy guy is bothering you, they will actually deal with him. All the guy bartenders are great. Kelly is great. Some of the other girl bartenders are not my favorite people in the world. Which is too bad for them. Finally, if you are into concert poster art, you will really appreciate the collection at Trace. Easily one of the better collections of any bar in the city.

I was here for a little bit late on evening and I didn't like it. Way way too crowded and a line get in to experience nothing. I'm hoping I can come back and have another experience to change my mind but this seems unlikely. So busy it was obnoxious though and the only draw was that it was open late.

If I wake up in the morning and don't quite recall where I was the night before, it usually means I wound up at Trace. Open until 4:00 A.M., this bar is best when there wasn't a Cubs night game because it will be filled with suburbites puking all over themselves after they've been drinking since 4:00 the afternoon prior. Always a fun time with a few regrets, not to be done often at risk of liver failure/loss of dignity.

Nice bar and don't know why it was mentioned in douchiest bars in Chicago. it look like a charming bar with nice art on the lower level. The bar is magnifcently created and loops into the next building on the first floor. the second floor was closed the Sunday night I went, but I am sure it is as nice up there too. The staff was ultra friendly on a dead night. Not really sure all this frat bashing going on, but it has been years since I went to Wrigleyville bars. This place would be a cool bar no matter what crowd it draws on a baseball or saturday night.
Don't appreciate having to wait & wait & wait at bar while bartender talks to his pals. It's good to keep the current customers happy, but don't piss off first timers at the bar!

I'd like to give this bar zero stars but I'll settle for the 1. First of all avoid the ugly bartender that works the bar in the side room all the way to the right, went on a mardi gras bar crawl in Wrigley and not only was she definitely uneducated on pouring drinks but she was completely rude and wouldn't serve any girls that came by. Why? Maybe she thought she was going to score with the guys she was serving because she bartends for a living? who knows. Overall she was very rude and should probably be fired after that. Also not only was she horribly pouring peoples drinks she wasn't even paying attention to the other side of the bar. I saw at least 5 different guys pour their own drinks, heck one guy poured ten + drinks. Basically this girl was a complete irresponsible and rude amateur. I'm definitely calling the general manager sometime this week to complain and warn them about this girl. Overall, service sucked because of her and I will never recommend this bar to anyone or step foot in it again.
Open late. Allow Irish people filter in after the other bars close in the summer...loved this place! Sound bouncers, great music. Will definitely go back when I go back to Chicago.

I've been here quite a few times since my last review and the 5 star rating still stands. SmartBar is fun if you want to dance until 5am but Trace is good if you just want to hang out with friends until the wee hours of the morning. If you check into Foursquare before midnight and show the bartender your check-in, you get a free shot of Patron to get the party started!

This was Stop number 3 in our night out Saturday night... I loved the look of this place.  Very casual with Rock band art all over the wall.  I would definitely hit this place back up for the chill vibe!  Loved the Gin and Tonics!!! And they have my favorite beer- Hacker Pschorr!! i'll be back.  This joint is actually open after everyone closes!!  Plus!!

I contacted the owner and he offered me a round of drinks, said that he'd talk to who was working that night, and suspend them. I sort of doubt the suspension part, frankly. I'm yet to take him up on it, but I thought it was a nice effort. I'm still skeeved out though!

It's the only place that's open at 4am on a Saturday, so that's the big draw-in. The drinks are reasonably priced (for the area), although the service can be slow when it's busy but what place isn't? The patrons I've encountered here have been nice and the bouncers are friendly. Come here late at night if you still feel like partying at 4am!

Got here early before a show at the Metro with a couple of friends; we were literally the only ones in the bar for a while and so got to chat extensively with the bartender, who was friendly and accommodating. We actually skipped the official concert afterparty to come back here, where we arrived just in time to get one of the last group booths and meet up with another friend. Drinks were tasty, respectably strong, and very, very reasonably priced for Chicago. The bar itself has a nice atmosphere and the crowd wasn't excessive or annoyingly douchey. As a random pick by a gal from out of town, I really couldn't have done any better.

I'm new to the city and on my first night out as a resident I asked around where to go for late night that wouldn't be too far from my house...everyone said Trace. I was sold! When I visited last time, I fell in love with the short line outside, the solid mix of music and the fact that they carry PURPLE HAZE. I'm not from NOLA, but it is definitely my second home :)  Thank you Trace for the great memories thus far and I'm sure I'll become a regular (once I find a job)!!

This is pretty much the only 5am bar in wrigley....yet all the frat trash from the bars down the street dont really come here. Perfect! I have always had fun here, there is usually a bit of a line but it moves quick. Inside is sometimes a little crowded but cmon is 2am and your drunk. Do you actually care? No, because an ice cold PBR/Old Style/or whatever tallboy was just handed to you by one of the awesome bartenders that work here.

We were on our way back to the train station to wait for the first service of the morning and stopped by for a night cap. We went in and not even a couple minutes later, they announced last call lol. They were nice enough though to let us order our last round for the night and we hung out for another 15-20 minutes or so before the lights came on.  Everyone including the bouncers were very friendly.

Picture you're in wrigleyville at 2:00 on friday and your bar is closed. You'll no doubt see 2 things:1. A huge group of people rush north even past taco bell and mcdonalds. 2. Rando people asking you where Trace is. Trace is a decent spot if you're in Wrigleyville and want a late night spot. Key words are "late night" and "wrigleyville" so you can conclude that you're gonna get some random riff raff from drunk frat boy types but the security handles them fairly easy. You can also conclude from those key words that this place is gonna be packed, and it is especially after 2:00 am or 3:00 am on saturday night. It gets really hard to move around there and if you don't have a table it kinda sucks. This is like the only spot I've never closed.  Trace is good if you just wanna go drink, for the ladies, I didn't notice too many "creepy guys" so its ok. But I'd prefer to hit up smartbar down the street to close up my night.

This bar is a disaster.  Most of the bartenders are hit and miss at best and there is no redeeming quality about this place.  Drinks are moderately priced.  Decor is just boring as hell and the big problem with this place is they have the same group of drunken regulars there every night.  It just gets depressing seeing the same losers there every time I've been there.   There is a reason this place is empty until all the other bars close.  Avoid it like the plague unless you're too hammered to care about anything.
Great spot to go when the party dies. I haven't had to pay for drinks yet so I don't know how expensive it is. I love the music, and I can't wait to go again.

Definitely a step up from other bars on the Wrigley Strip of Bros*.  My friends and I were not the most experienced Wrigley-goers, so we followed a few people when they said that Trace was a fun bar that they liked. We had a nice time at Trace. It was not too crowded or too loud, but far from dead or boring. There could've been more seating, but somehow we managed. The bartender was nice and very prompt. Her pours were a bit weak, which was fine by me since I'm a lightweight, but it's just a helpful tip for all of you normal people out there. :) Needless to say, it was a good vodka soda. I thought she said it was $9, so I handed her a $10, but then she gave me $5 in singles. Although I thought it was $9, apparently it was a loud bar since the weak vodka soda was really $5. That sort of surprise is always fun. (But $5 for a drink in Wrigleyville? I'm starting to think that that's a decent price. Good for them.) The upstairs area had bartenders that were much less attentive. It took about 15 minutes just to get shots, but it might also be because a bunch of men were sitting at the bar and slowly sipping beers, not, you know, letting other people order. Ugh. Trace was overall a lot of fun, and around 2am, it gets a bit crazy, but it was a fun time, and I'd probably go back. *I may sound snarky, but let's be real, some of the bros we observed were good looking. Embarrassing. If you know of a help line I can call for counseling, please advise me. Thanks.

When the 2am bar closes, just go home. I didn't take my own advice. Shots always seem like a good idea at the after hours bar. Rarely are shots ever a good way to cap off a night of drinking. I had a good time here and I made a ton of friends (don't we all when booze is involved). I typically hate going out in the area but sometimes I like to pretend like i'm back in a college town and I think this is the perfect location to do that. You might roll your eyes a lot but I think you'll have an ok time if not better. Consider this useful, funny and cool.

I was here once in 2007 and I didn't think it was anything special. Some buddies of mine were hanging here and invited me over during that terrible storm on Friday afternoon a week ago. Real chill, down to earth people here and the service was cool. They had a guy playing the guitar near the front window which was ok. It got the crowd excited! They also carry one of my favorite beers here: La Fin Du Monde. I introduced my buddies to it and they loved it! I had 3 and my night seemed to coming to an end due to the 9% alcohol content that particular beer carries. Very close to Wrigley and a pretty cool spot!

Decent beer selection, great bartender when i was there (hello free soco and lime) pluuuus there were some posters on the wall that i'm envious of.  it's right by the metro and a great pregaming location!

Trace is not what I would have expected from an after-hours Wrigleyville bar. Not even close. We arrived just slightly before the 2am rush and were able to snag a booth on the first floor of the chic little lounge. The elevated U shaped booths are HUGE and easily fit 6 people while being wide enough for the 3 remaining standing members of our group plenty of room to stand around the outer edge. It was a great setup for a large amount of people to be able to talk to one another while remaining stationery.  The music wasn't very loud, so we could actually hear what the person next to us was saying. Has that ever been true of any late night bar? The crowd also isn't what you'd expect. Apparently the patrons of Barleycorn and Moe's Cantina haven't gotten the memo about the newest late night bar on the block yet. Gone were the Chads and Trixies and in their place, an older (if only by a few years) more chilled out scene. The average age of a patron here is probably 28 and isn't killing time trying to sober up before heading back out to the burbs. I have found my new late night stomping grounds.

This is a great Wrigleyville bar. If you want away from the crowds and something a little more chill  and cheaper- Trace is the best choice. The music is generally softer so you can actually hear each other. Because it's close, I go year round.  The bartenders are nice and attentive as well as the ownership. The upstairs bar is available for rent and has live music sometimes. This is a 4 o'clock bar so arrive before 2 to skip the line... I get there about 9 to have time to chat with friends before it gets crazy! Hope to see you there :)
I will never go hear again. The Bar Staff and Security are a Bunch of A*** H****.

While I wouldn't say Trace is my first choice destination spot, I wasn't disappointed.  Simple bar atmosphere, moderately priced drinks and a relatively non-fratty environment.  Double bonus: I saw a dude wearing a bright green Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles sweatshirt here on a Saturday night. That's worth three stars alone in my book.  Oh yes, they're open late, so get there before 2am to avoid a line.

Small dark bar near Wrigley Field. Limited booth seating, bar seating and nothing else but standing room. Strong drinks,  friendly bartenders, cheap prices.  Come early because the place gets packed with people.  When I say early... I mean by 1 or 1:30 am.  Place closes at 4 am which is a novelty in CA.
Decided to give Trace another try a few days ago.  The music had improved, actually heard some Pantera.  This time, only half of the televisions were playing ESPN and they even did a "last call."

Pretty small bar in Wrigley. The nice thing is that it was a relatively calm place despite us visiting right after a game. Liked the interior and the big booths. Had a pretty strong mixed drink... can't complain about that! I look forward to visiting Trace again and seeing what the night time offers.

This is a good bar and generally has good music. i remember my cynical lawyer friend walking into Trace, he's a hard sell, quietly taking in the music and beer selections, and opining "wow, this place's music is like my iPod and the beer's pretty great."  i've been here any number of times and so has my friend.

Two of my friends and I had joint bday party here, and it couldn't have been better. Few of my friends knew of Trace (at least since it reopened) but they all loved it and now it's one of our favorite spots. Since we had a large group (50) they gave us the upstairs. The space had great flow with a good mix of booths, tables, and bar stools. The decor was edgy without trying too hard. I found the staff to be perfectly friendly and fast, while the managers seemed to sincerely care that we were having a good time. Meanwhile the downstairs was busy without being obnoxiously packed.  For me it was a great find, because I live in the area but find most of the bars to be redundant. But I kinda hope it doesn't become too popular... because I really like the way it is right now.

I stopped by this place waiting for a group of friends that never showed up, but alas, that's neither here nor there...I was happy to spend my time in Trace. I liked the decor; it has the feel of a casual bar without being trashy or pumped up on muscle milk. There were two big televisions that I saw that had sports games on. The music selection was good, I'm thinking Interpol, and not so loud you can't talk. There's a good selection of beers on tap that are average-ly priced for the area ($5 for a glass of hacker-pschorr).  The bartender was friendly and quick. The crowd was laid-back, no annoying freaks that so frequently crop up in this 'hood.

Trace.  Interesting name for a bar.  Came here the other night after a Cubs game as an alternative to all the other sports bars in the area.   Huge bar on the first floor and a quieter second floor which surprisingly wasn't open on the night I was there. Plenty of beers to choose from (15 in bottle, 12 or so on tap) so you won't go thirsty.  Well, maybe you will - cuz just getting a bartender to acknowledge you is a feat in this place.

This a great bar a stone's kick from Wrigley field. The decor doesn't  stand out. But, I am new to Chicago and I found the people to be really friendly. The bartender was quick and fun. The drinks were wicked cheap - $6 for a Ketel One and tonic! FYI - $15 minimum for credit cards.
Fun and friendly bar. Cool bartenders. Nice upstairs private space with DJ booth and full bar. Awesome music (Read: Postal Service)  Kinda reminds me of a chill Colorado-vibey bar. Love it.

I went to Trace after the Cubs game Monday (home opener).  Last time I was there was for the St. Jude Pub Crawl and had a blast!  We ordered our drinks and were just chillin.  Not many were there and the music was somewhat loud.  My buddy showed up....and he order a water.  Drank like 2 waters for over a course of an hour.  Then he decided to order a round of shots before we all head home.  The bartender wouldn't serve him!  Sure you see guys drunk at bars after the game but my buddy wasn't drunk.  He did have water and paced himself...but some people need to work the next day.  Then the bartender kicked him out of the bar!  I never seen anything like this and was very disappointed.  All I can think of is maybe the bartender is a Sox fan?!?!   We will never go back to this place.

They always have good music here.  The staff is really nice.  The first time we went here the bartender gave us a free shot just because we had never been there before.  That is how you make me a new patron...   We explained that we were having a charity pub crawl and the staff got together and MADE me have the bar crawl come through trace.  They all wanted to be part of it.  They gave us the upstairs room to ourselves, let us bring pizza in from Red Ivy to sell by the slice, gave us the best specials out of all of the bars, and let us use the AV equip for our raffle.  Thanks guys!

I really didn't like it.  I went for a party upstairs...the music was too loud...by the time I left i had a SPLITTING headache. I guess to each his own regarding bars/lounges/clubs what not, so here is MINE....i didn't like it.  I would 500x more love to be at Smartbar...which is a few doors down.  Long live house music!!!

I LOVE this bar.  Its laid-back and fun environement is the reason why my friend and I threw our joint birthday party there.  We were able to reserve the upstairs party room for no charge and worked out an awesome drink package with our host.  Even though there were two of us, we BOTH received complimentary drink bracelets!   The bar has very cool artwork and is perfect for either great conversations (tons of seating) or dancing.

I agree with most of the other reviews. Very relaxed vibe and it is definitely missing the post-college frat and soror girls that frequent Wrigleyville. Lots of tv and menus to order in from the bartender!

CHILLIN' ON CLARK Trace is the perfect place to grab a few drinks pre-game and to chill out post-game when you want a relaxed vibe in a douche-bag free environment.  It's also a great place to meet your friends before you head out to other bars since there's no line to get in and it's never obnoxiously crowded like Casey Moran's or the Cubby Bear.

I always seem to have a good time here because the music and the crowds are fun.  I usually hang out in the  upstairs area (mostly go there for private parties), and my only complaint is that there is only one bathroom.  There always seems to be a line.  As far as Wrigleyville bars go, this is one of the few I would actually want to hang out at.

As someone who neither wants to spend time around sports fans or pretentious poets, I often feel as if I'm supposed to be the type of person who would hate a place like the Trace, especially considering it's in the heart of Wrigleyville.  But I just can't. It has a great low-light ambiance, the bartenders are all down to earth and even when I'm the craziest dressed person there, I never feel out of place.  I know a lot of its clientele is frat boys and sorority girls, past or present, but they're usually the good kind.   It's not particularly cheap, but it's not particularly expensive either, and it provides a nice oasis between the rowdy sports bar on one side and the rowdy hipster bar on the other.

Great atmosphere here. Very chill and few annoying frat types. The staff is very fun and there are some great drink specials on Tuesday when Polyrhythmic is there (see Bianca's review.) The regulars are also really friendly.

A cool outpost in Wrigleyville that doesn't have the same drunken frat boy feel as the other bars in the neighborhood (except during games). The staff is really personable and quick to befriend a newcomer.
pretty decent bar.. it doesn't get as crowded as some of the other ones right near wrigley

I liked it here..very chill and a good atmosphere. We came here before we went out to get a few beers. If you want a relaxing, clean atmosphere this is the place. The windows in the front are often open to let some fresh air in.

Good vibes can be had at this simple bar right by Wrigly Field. Frequented by beer vendors and people walking towards the metra train station on Irving Park. A good crowd of geeky fair weather Cubs fans and silly rockstar vendors. Ask for Dan and Pete on gameday, they'll explain anything you want to know on vending.
Near the stadium and a favorite for beer vendors to go after they finish their shift.
